item.description:
Celebrate Flower Festival, known as Hana-masturi, which honors the birth of the historical Buddha over 2,500 years ago. Come and join us in our multi-media presentation of the birth story and learn about the basic teachings of the Buddha, wash and offer flowers to the baby Buddha, listen to sacred chants and more. Bring flower(s) to offer to the baby Buddha on the altar. This community event is great for new to Buddhism, families and friends. Lead by Rev. Daishin Senpai.

We offer complimentary meditation lessons for those new to buddhism. Just arrive 15 min. before 10 a.m. and ask the person at the front desk for the mini lesson.


Visit our main website  at www.bffct.net for Calendar and more information on our beliefs and practices.

 

p.s. REMINDER - Hosted by the Buddhist Faith Fellowship. Even though just one or two people from Meetup have RSVPed, you can expect 35 - 45 people in attendance.
